name: Consulting Proposal â€” Brief 10-Slide Template
purpose: A concise, client-ready proposal deck for consulting engagements (10 slides). Optimized for clarity, decision-making, and fast alignment.
audience: Economic buyer and key stakeholders at the client (e.g., sponsor, project lead, finance).

structure.title: Cover
structure.description: Front page identifying the client, engagement title, your firm, and the date, with a discreet confidentiality footer. Keep the visual design minimal and executive in tone.

structure.title: Executive Summary & Recommendation
structure.description: A one-page narrative that states the business challenge, why action is needed now, the proposed solution at a glance, and the headline outcomes. Write it so a busy executive could approve based on this page alone.

structure.title: Client Context & Objectives
structure.description: Summarize the client's current situation (market, organization, tech/ops), key constraints, and what success looks like. Clearly define measurable objectives and note what is in scope versus explicitly out of scope.

structure.title: Proposed Approach & Methodology
structure.description: Describe the phased approach, the methods and tools to be used (e.g., stakeholder interviews, data analysis, workshops), and how you will collaborate with client teams to accelerate learning and de-risk delivery.

structure.title: Workplan, Timeline & Milestones
structure.description: Lay out a realistic week-by-week plan (or sprint plan) with key milestones, decision gates, and dependencies. Highlight the governance rhythm (steering committee, stand-ups, showcases) that keeps momentum and oversight.

structure.title: Deliverables & Success Metrics
structure.description: List the tangible deliverables with indicative timing and owners, and define how success will be measured using business-relevant KPIs and leading indicators. Explain how benefits realization will be tracked post-delivery.

structure.title: Team, Roles & Ways of Working
structure.description: Introduce the core consulting team and client counterparts, clarify roles and responsibilities (e.g., via a concise RACI), and outline working norms including communication channels, tooling, and response-time expectations.

structure.title: Relevant Experience & Case Studies
structure.description: Demonstrate credibility with brief, outcome-focused examples that mirror the client's context. Emphasize quantified results, comparable environments, and any available testimonials or references (with permission).

structure.title: Commercials, Assumptions & Terms
structure.description: Present the pricing model (fixed/T&M/hybrid), what is included, and the critical assumptions and client responsibilities underpinning the estimate. Summarize payment schedule and high-level commercial terms, plus change control.

structure.title: Risks, Mitigations & Next Steps
structure.description: Call out the top delivery and adoption risks with practical mitigations and owners. Close with a clear decision checklist and immediate next steps to initiate the engagement (e.g., kickoff date, data access, stakeholder scheduling).
